Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(1% Sales Tax Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to rededicate the 1% sales and use tax previously authorized by an election held on November 16, 1985, as subsequently rededicated at an election held on January 19, 2002, to add to the dedicated purposes the additional purpose of constructing, acquiring, extending, improving and maintaining the Parishwide Waterworks Treatment and Distribution System in the District, to be levied in perpetuity and to continue the authority to fund the proceeds of the tax into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall the St. John the Baptist Parish Sales Tax District (the "District"), having been previously authorized at an election held in the District on November 16, 1985, to levy and collect a one percent (1%) sales and use tax (the "Tax") (an estimated $8,650,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), dedicated to the purposes of constructing, acquiring, extending, improving and maintaining sewers and sewage disposal facilities in the District and acquiring equipment therefor, and subsequently at an election held on January 19, 2002 rededicated said Tax by adding the dedicated purposes of constructing, acquiring and improving roads, highways and bridges in the District, be further rededicated after providing for payment of the principal, interest and reserve requirements of any and all sales and use tax bonds of the District previously sold and issued by said District, to add the additional purpose of constructing, acquiring, extending, improving and maintaining the Parishwide Waterworks Treatment and Distribution System in the District, said tax to be levied in perpetuity and to continue the District's authority to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds for paying the cost of making capital improvements for all the purposes for which the Tax was originally authorized and/or for the additional purposes added by rededications, in the manner permitted by law, including in particular, Sub-Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950?
